DataElement.preferredName: Persistent Progressive Disease Post Radiation Therapy Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria Code Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The coded response to determine patient eligibility for clinical trial participation for questions related to persistent/progressive disease after treatment of a disease by radiation as outlined in the protocol.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Persistent Progressive Disease Post Radiation Therapy Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A disease that does not go to remission despite treatment._Cancer that is increasing in scope or severity._Happening at a time subsequent to a reference time; later in time or order._Treatment of a disease by means of exposure of the target or the whole body to radiation. Radiation therapy is often used as part of curative therapy and occasionally as a component of palliative treatment for cancer. Other uses include total body irradiation prior to transplantation._Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A disease that does not go to remission despite treatment.:Cancer that is increasing in scope or severity.

Concepts.definition: A disease that does not go to remission despite treatment.
A clinical, pathologic, and/or molecular finding indicating that the course of a disease is worsening in terms of extent or severity.

Property.preferredName: Post Radiation Therapy Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
Property.preferredDefinition: Happening at a time subsequent to a reference time; later in time or order.:Treatment of a disease by means of exposure of the target or the whole body to radiation. Radiation therapy is often used as part of curative therapy and occasionally as a component of palliative treatment for cancer. Other uses include total body irradiation prior to transplantation.:Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

Concepts.definition: Happening at a time subsequent to a reference time; later in time or order.

Treatment of a disease by means of exposure of the target or the whole body to radiation. Radiation therapy is often used as part of curative therapy and occasionally as a component of palliative treatment for cancer. Other uses include total body irradiation prior to transplantation.
Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Indicator to represent a response of Yes, No, or Not Applicable._The affirmative response to a question or activity._The non-affirmative response to a question._Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context._A system of numbered categories for representation of data.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

Concepts.definition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.:The non-affirmative response to a question.:Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context.:A system of numbered categories for representation of data.:An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.
The non-affirmative response to a question.
Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.
A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.

An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: Created to support Theradex design of CRFs for NCI CCR trials

ReferenceDocuments.name: If tumor located within previ
ReferenceDocuments.description: If tumor located within previous radiated field will not be designated as "non-type"  lesion, has progression been documented or a biopsy obtained to confirm persistence at least 90 days following completion of radiation therapy?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: If tumor is located within previously radiated field, it will be designated as "non-target" lesion, unless progression has been documented or a biopsy obtained to confirm persistence at least 90 days following completion of radiation therapy?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is patient more than 12 weeks from therapy or if within 12 weeks of radiotherapy, then the progressive lesion must be outside of the high-dose radiation target volume or patient has unequivocal evidence of progressive tumor on a biopsy specimen?
